title: Workshop on Solving H∞ Control Problems Using Reinforcement Q-Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory control theory and linear systems comprehension, with high school-level mathematics (including matrix operations)
context.additional_context: Learners can utilize smartphone-based data collection tools and have practical experience in solving engineering problems

learning_goals: The H∞ control performance metric in Markov jump systems can be mathematically interpreted
The procedure for optimizing control policies using reinforcement Q-learning algorithms can be explained
Optimal disturbance suppression levels can be derived through project-based assessments utilizing actual system models

resources: DC Motor Simulator Kit (1 set per group)
LMI (Linear Matrix Inequality) Calculation Example Sheet
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
